senses.de: To consist of a particular material or substance.
senses.ex: The table is made of wood.

Tips.title: Describing materials
Tips.description: Use 'be made of' to describe the material something is constructed from.
Tips.example: This shirt is made of 100% cotton.

Tips.title: Not for processes
Tips.description: Don't use 'be made of' to describe a process. Use 'be made from' for that.
Tips.example: Wine is made from grapes. (NOT made of)

Tips.title: Visible components
Tips.description: 'Be made of' implies the materials are still visible or easily identifiable in the final product.
Tips.example: The cake is made of flour, sugar, and eggs.

consist of.wordDefinition: 'Consist of' is more formal and emphasizes the constituent parts. 'Be made of' is more common and focuses on the material.

comprise.wordDefinition: 'Comprise' is similar to 'consist of' but is often used in a more technical or official context.

be composed of.wordDefinition: 'Be composed of' is more formal than 'be made of' and often used for abstract or complex things.
